English article translated by Google Translate.Google Translate is working hard to improve understanding, and assumes that there are errors in the English translation.ã€‘Buan-gun holds 'Rice cultivation technology field demonstration'Development of Rural Development Administration, dry paddy field slashingâ€¦Labor distribution, etcReporter Lee Han-shinThe 'Rice Dry Paddy Field Harrowing Cultivation Technology Field Exhibition', which has the effect of preventing water pollution and easing the labor force concentrated during the busy farming season, was held in Buan.On the 29th, Buan-gun, Jeollabuk-do, held the exhibition in the garden of Mosan-ri, Buan-eup, with the Rural Development Administration and about 100 people, including officials from city and county agricultural technology centers and agricultural groups, in attendance.This exhibition was prepared to inform people of the importance of labor reduction and low-carbon rice cultivation and to share innovative cultivation technologies that can be applied in the field.In particular, agricultural machinery such as automatic water gates, levelers, simultaneous tilling, rotary machines, and drones necessary for agricultural technology were also exhibited, allowing a quick look.The 'dry paddy field slashing' technology is a technology developed by the National Institute of Crop Science, Rural Development Administration, which involves breaking and leveling the soil while the paddy is dry, then watering and transplanting right away.This method omits the slashing process that was essential in conventional cultivation, saving labor and work time, and has the effect of reducing water pollution by suppressing the occurrence of turbid water.Also, it was found that the supply of oxygen to the roots was smooth, methane gas generation was reduced, and there was no significant difference in quantity and quality compared to conventional methods.This technology is divided into 'standard' and 'distributed' depending on the work period.The 'standard' method is to perform dry soil plowing and leveling 5-6 days before transplanting, and then fill the paddy field with water 4-5 days before transplanting, and then intensively prepare the paddy field.The work period is shorter than the existing method, and the total labor time can be reduced.'Distributed' can disperse labor and ease the burden on farmers by completing plowing and leveling work in advance during the off-season (March to April) when it does not rain, and then transplanting rice during the busy season (May to June).Currently, in the Buan area, Mr. Yong-hwa Kim of Shindeok Agricultural Company is promoting a pilot project.Mr. Kim said, "If we disperse the rice paddy preparation work by season using the dry paddy hulling transplanting cultivation technology, we expect it will help alleviate the labor shortage problem during the busy season," and "We plan to expand the cultivation area from 5.5 ha to over 50 ha."Kwon Jae-han, the head of the Rural Development Administration, emphasized, "In the past, weeding before planting rice was essential, but recently, with the development of agricultural machinery and pest control technology, it has become optional." He added, "We hope that the technology for weeding dry fields will be expanded to the field, reducing the burden of labor on farmers and achieving environmental conservation effects."Buan County Governor Kwon Ik-hyeon said, "As the burden on farmers increases day by day due to population decline, aging, labor costs, and rising agricultural material prices, we will do our best to expand and disseminate the technology for transplanting rice into dry fields to realize low-carbon agriculture and open a new future for agriculture by stabilizing rice cultivation methods."ì›ë³¸ ê¸°ì‚¬
